messageBody:
Vince,

On 10/23/07, Vince Cordaro <ovisual12@...> wrote:
> First off let me say thanks for all the great
> responses. I think I am going to roll with MockEJB
> for testing. However I have posted a question to the
> mockejb mailing list and have yet to get a solid
> response. It seems all the tutorials I come across
> for MockEJB seem to deal with EJB2.1 . The examples
> define a SessionBeanDescriptor which takes in , JNDI
> name, Home Class, Local/Remote Interface, and Bean
> Class. The problem is that in EJB3 I do not need to
> define a Home Class so what should I pass as a
> parameter? I know this is no exactly on the subject
> of junit but it seems many of you have worked with
> MockEJB before and this would probably be a quick
> answer. Maybe I can build an MockEJB and EJB3
> tutorial.

Testing EJB 3 components has gotten so much easier compared to the 2.x
spec that you don't really need much of a framework to do that. Having
said that, the best places I know of to look for assistance are
Ejb3Unit (http://ejb3unit.sourceforge.net) and the freely available
sample chapter of my book (http://www.manning.com/koskela).

Lasse
